tasks.title: Setup Supabase Project and Database Schema
tasks.description: Initialize Supabase project and create the database schema for users, projects, project_members, and tasks tables as specified in the PRD.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new Supabase project
2. Configure authentication settings for email/password login
3. Create the following tables with appropriate relationships:
   - `projects` (id, title, description, owner_id, created_at)
   - `project_members` (id, project_id, user_id)
   - `tasks` (id, project_id, title, description, status, due_date, assignee_id, created_by, created_at, updated_at)
4. Set up appropriate foreign key constraints
5. Configure row-level security policies for data access control
6. Create necessary indexes for performance optimization
<info added on 2025-06-19T05:52:42.026Z>
6. Update the database schema based on 2024 best practices:

   - Users Table:
     ```sql
     CREATE TABLE users (
       id UUID DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4() PRIMARY KEY,
       email TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
       encrypted_password TEXT NOT NULL,
       full_name TEXT,
       avatar_url TEXT,
       created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
       updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
     );
     CREATE INDEX idx_users_email ON users(email);
     ```

   - Projects Table:
     ```sql
     CREATE TABLE projects (
       id UUID DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4() PRIMARY KEY,
       title TEXT NOT NULL,
       description TEXT,
       owner_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
       created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
       updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
     );
     CREATE INDEX idx_projects_owner_id ON projects(owner_id);
     ```

   - Project Members Table:
     ```sql
     CREATE TABLE project_members (
       id UUID DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4() PRIMARY KEY,
       project_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES projects(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
       user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
       role TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (role IN ('owner', 'admin', 'member')),
       created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
       UNIQUE(project_id, user_id)
     );
     CREATE INDEX idx_project_members_project_user ON project_members(project_id, user_id);
     ```

   - Tasks Table:
     ```sql
     CREATE TABLE tasks (
       id UUID DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4() PRIMARY KEY,
       project_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES projects(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
       title TEXT NOT NULL,
       description TEXT,
       status TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (status IN ('todo', 'in_progress', 'done')),
       due_date DATE,
       assignee_id UUID REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
       created_by UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES users(id),
       created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
       updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
     );
     CREATE INDEX idx_tasks_project_id ON tasks(project_id);
     CREATE INDEX idx_tasks_assignee_id ON tasks(assignee_id);
     CREATE INDEX idx_tasks_status ON tasks(status);
     CREATE INDEX idx_tasks_due_date ON tasks(due_date);
     ```

7. Implement RLS policies for each table:
   - Users: Allow users to read/update only their own data
   - Projects: Allow access only to project members
   - Project Members: Allow read access to members, management to owners/admins
   - Tasks: Allow read access to project members, create/update/delete based on role

8. Consider additional best practices:
   - Use UUIDs for primary keys
   - Include created_at/updated_at timestamps
   - Implement check constraints for valid values
   - Use cascading deletes for referential integrity
   - Add unique constraints where appropriate
</info added on 2025-06-19T05:52:42.026Z>

<info added on 2025-06-20T10:15:33.000Z>
9. PERMISSION ISSUE IDENTIFIED: Need to use proper authentication context instead of anon key for table creation.

10. UPDATED SQL APPROACH based on 2024 best practices:

   - Use gen_random_uuid() instead of uuid_generate_v4() (newer best practice)
   - Use TIMEZONE('utc'::text, NOW()) for timestamps
   - Create enum types for status fields
   - Updated SQL examples:

   - Create Task Status Enum:
     ```sql
     CREATE TYPE task_status AS ENUM ('todo', 'in_progress', 'done');  
     ```

   - Users Table:
     ```sql
     CREATE TABLE users (
       id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY,
       email TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
       encrypted_password TEXT NOT NULL,
       full_name TEXT,
       avatar_url TEXT,
       created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT TIMEZONE('utc'::text, NOW()),
       updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT TIMEZONE('utc'::text, NOW())
     );
     CREATE INDEX idx_users_email ON users(email);
     ```

   - Projects Table:
     ```sql
     CREATE TABLE projects (
       id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY,
       title TEXT NOT NULL,
       description TEXT,
       owner_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
       created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT TIMEZONE('utc'::text, NOW()),
       updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT TIMEZONE('utc'::text, NOW())
     );
     CREATE INDEX idx_projects_owner_id ON projects(owner_id);
     ```

   - Project Members Table:
     ```sql
     CREATE TYPE member_role AS ENUM ('owner', 'admin', 'member');
     
     CREATE TABLE project_members (
       id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY,
       project_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES projects(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
       user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
       role member_role NOT NULL,
       created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT TIMEZONE('utc'::text, NOW()),
       UNIQUE(project_id, user_id)
     );
     CREATE INDEX idx_project_members_project_user ON project_members(project_id, user_id);
     ```

   - Tasks Table:
     ```sql
     CREATE TABLE tasks (
       id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY,
       project_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES projects(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
       title TEXT NOT NULL,
       description TEXT,
       status task_status NOT NULL DEFAULT 'todo',
       due_date DATE,
       assignee_id UUID REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
       created_by UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES users(id),
       created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT TIMEZONE('utc'::text, NOW()),
       updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT TIMEZONE('utc'::text, NOW())
     );
     CREATE INDEX idx_tasks_project_id ON tasks(project_id);
     CREATE INDEX idx_tasks_assignee_id ON tasks(assignee_id);
     CREATE INDEX idx_tasks_status ON tasks(status);
     CREATE INDEX idx_tasks_due_date ON tasks(due_date);
     ```

subtasks.title: Implement Team Member Management
subtasks.description: Create functionality for managing team members within a single organization
subtasks.details: Implement interfaces for adding and removing team members. Create admin controls for managing team members. Develop UI components for displaying team member lists and their roles. Ensure proper role assignment (admin/member) for new team members.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test team member addition, removal, and role assignment functionality. Verify admin controls work correctly and that proper permissions are enforced.

subtasks.title: Implement Basic User Roles
subtasks.description: Add support for basic user roles (admin/member) for team access control
subtasks.details: Create role-based permission system with admin and member roles. Implement role checks in the auth context. Add UI elements that conditionally render based on user role. Ensure role information is stored and retrieved properly from Supabase.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test role-based access controls for different user types. Verify UI elements correctly show or hide based on user roles. Test permission checks in various scenarios.

tasks.title: Create Sidebar Navigation Component
tasks.description: Develop a persistent left-hand sidebar that displays the user's projects and navigation controls for switching between views.
tasks.details:
1. Create a responsive sidebar component that works on both desktop and mobile
2. Implement collapsible/expandable functionality for mobile view
3. Add navigation links for Home, Projects, Calendar, etc.
4. Fetch and display the user's projects from Supabase
5. Add a 'Create New Project' button
6. Style using Tailwind CSS with a clean, minimal design
7. Highlight the active navigation item
8. Include user profile information/avatar at the top or bottom
tasks.testStrategy: Test sidebar rendering and responsiveness across different screen sizes. Verify project list fetching and display. Test navigation between different views. Ensure mobile collapse/expand functionality works correctly.

tasks.title: Implement Project Management
tasks.description: Create functionality for users to create, view, edit, and delete projects, as well as manage project members for collaboration.
tasks.details:
1. Create a 'New Project' form with fields for title and description
2. Implement project listing page showing all projects the user has access to
3. Add project detail view with edit/delete capabilities
4. Create a project members management interface
5. Implement functionality to invite users to projects (by email)
6. Create database queries to:
   - Insert new projects
   - Update existing projects
   - Delete projects (with cascade to tasks)
   - Add/remove project members
7. Ensure proper permissions checking before operations
tasks.testStrategy: Test project CRUD operations. Verify project listing shows only projects the user has access to. Test adding and removing project members. Verify permissions are enforced correctly for different user roles.

tasks.title: Develop Task CRUD Functionality
tasks.description: Implement the core task management functionality allowing users to create, read, update, and delete tasks within projects.
tasks.details:
1. Create a task form component with fields for:
   - Title
   - Description
   - Status (dropdown)
   - Due date (date picker)
   - Assignee (user selector)
2. Implement modal for task creation/editing
3. Add task deletion with confirmation
4. Create Supabase queries for task CRUD operations
5. Implement form validation
6. Add keyboard shortcuts for common actions
7. Ensure proper error handling and user feedback
tasks.testStrategy: Test task creation, editing, and deletion. Verify form validation works correctly. Test error handling with invalid inputs or network failures. Verify task data is correctly saved to and retrieved from the database.

tasks.title: Build Kanban Board View
tasks.description: Create a Kanban board interface with columns for different task statuses (To Do, In Progress, Done) and drag-and-drop functionality.
tasks.details:
1. Install and configure `react-beautiful-dnd`
2. Create a board component with columns for each status
3. Implement drag-and-drop functionality between columns
4. Update task status in the database when moved between columns
5. Add visual feedback during drag operations
6. Implement task cards with key information (title, assignee, due date)
7. Add click handler to open task details modal
8. Ensure responsive design for different screen sizes
9. Optimize performance for boards with many tasks
tasks.testStrategy: Test drag-and-drop functionality between columns. Verify task status updates correctly in the database. Test responsiveness on different devices. Verify task cards display correct information. Test performance with a large number of tasks.

tasks.title: Implement Calendar View
tasks.description: Create a calendar view that displays tasks with due dates in a monthly/weekly layout using react-big-calendar.
tasks.details:
1. Install and configure `react-big-calendar`
2. Create a calendar component that displays tasks with due dates
3. Implement view switching (month, week, day)
4. Add click handlers to view/edit tasks from calendar
5. Style calendar events based on task status
6. Implement date navigation (prev/next month, today)
7. Ensure responsive design for different screen sizes
8. Add filters for viewing specific project tasks
tasks.testStrategy: Test calendar rendering with tasks having due dates. Verify view switching between month/week/day. Test task viewing/editing from calendar events. Verify date navigation works correctly. Test responsiveness on different devices.

tasks.title: Enable Multi-User Collaboration
tasks.description: Implement functionality for multiple users to collaborate on shared projects, including project member management and permissions.
tasks.details:
1. Enhance project members management interface
2. Implement email invitation system for new members
3. Create user search/selection for adding members
4. Define and implement permission levels (owner, admin, member)
5. Update database queries to respect user permissions
6. Add UI indicators for task ownership/assignment
7. Implement user avatars and presence indicators
8. Create project activity feed (optional)
tasks.testStrategy: Test adding and removing project members. Verify permissions are enforced correctly for different user roles. Test email invitations if implemented. Verify UI correctly shows task ownership and assignments.

tasks.title: Implement View Switching and Navigation
tasks.description: Create a unified interface for switching between Board and Calendar views within projects, with consistent navigation and state management.
tasks.details:
1. Create a view selector component (tabs or buttons)
2. Implement state management for current view
3. Ensure data consistency between views
4. Add URL-based navigation (e.g., /project/123/board, /project/123/calendar)
5. Preserve view preference per user
6. Add smooth transitions between views
7. Ensure responsive design for view switching
tasks.testStrategy: Test switching between Board and Calendar views. Verify URL-based navigation works correctly. Test data consistency between views. Verify view preferences are saved and restored correctly.

tasks.title: Deploy Application to Vercel and Supabase
tasks.description: Configure and deploy the frontend application to Vercel and ensure proper connection to the Supabase backend.
tasks.details:
1. Prepare the application for production build
2. Configure environment variables for production
3. Set up a Vercel account and project
4. Configure build settings and environment variables in Vercel
5. Deploy the frontend application
6. Test the deployed application
7. Set up proper CORS configuration in Supabase
8. Configure custom domain (if applicable)
9. Set up CI/CD for automatic deployment on code changes
tasks.testStrategy: Verify the application builds and deploys successfully. Test all functionality in the production environment. Verify authentication works correctly with the production Supabase instance. Test performance and responsiveness of the deployed application.

tasks.title: Implement Final UI Polish and Optimizations
tasks.description: Refine the user interface, add loading states, error handling, and optimize performance for a production-ready application.
tasks.details:
1. Add loading indicators for async operations
2. Implement error handling and user-friendly error messages
3. Add empty states for lists and views
4. Optimize component rendering and memoization
5. Implement code splitting for better load times
6. Add subtle animations and transitions
7. Ensure consistent styling across all components
8. Perform accessibility audit and improvements
9. Optimize for mobile usage
10. Add final UI polish and refinements
tasks.testStrategy: Perform usability testing with different user personas. Test loading states and error handling. Verify performance metrics using Lighthouse or similar tools. Test accessibility using screen readers and keyboard navigation. Verify responsive design on various devices.

tasks.title: Prepare Application for Multi-Tenancy and SaaS Evolution
tasks.description: Implement multi-tenancy features and SaaS infrastructure to prepare the application for scaling across multiple organizations, including database schema updates, organization management, subdomain-based tenancy, billing infrastructure, and tenant onboarding flows.
tasks.details:
1. Update database schema:
   - Add 'organizations' table with fields: id, name, subdomain, created_at, updated_at
   - Modify 'users' table to include organization_id (foreign key to organizations)
   - Update 'projects' and 'tasks' tables to include organization_id
   - Implement row-level security policies for organization-based data access

2. Implement organization management:
   - Create CRUD operations for organizations in the backend
   - Develop UI for organization creation, editing, and member management
   - Implement invite system for adding users to organizations

3. Prepare for subdomain-based tenancy:
   - Configure DNS and routing to handle subdomains
   - Implement middleware to determine current organization based on subdomain
   - Update authentication flow to scope logins to specific organizations

4. Add billing infrastructure foundation:
   - Integrate a billing provider (e.g., Stripe)
   - Create 'subscriptions' and 'billing_events' tables in the database
   - Implement basic subscription management and usage tracking

5. Create tenant onboarding flows:
   - Develop a step-by-step onboarding process for new organizations
   - Include organization setup, initial user creation, and subscription selection
   - Implement email verification and welcome sequence

6. Update existing components for multi-tenancy:
   - Modify project and task queries to filter by organization
   - Update UI components to display organization context
   - Implement organization switching for users belonging to multiple organizations

7. Enhance authentication and authorization:
   - Implement role-based access control within organizations
   - Update JWT tokens to include organization information
   - Modify protected routes to check for organization-level permissions

8. Optimize performance for multi-tenant scenarios:
   - Implement database indexing strategies for organization-based queries
   - Consider implementing caching mechanisms for frequently accessed data
   - Optimize API endpoints for multi-tenant data retrieval

9. Implement data isolation and backup strategies:
   - Ensure proper data segregation between organizations
   - Implement organization-specific data export and backup features

10. Update testing suite:
    - Add multi-tenancy specific test cases
    - Implement organization context in existing tests
    - Create performance tests for multi-tenant scenarios
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Database Schema Verification:
   - Verify the creation of the 'organizations' table and updates to existing tables
   - Test foreign key constraints and cascading operations
   - Validate row-level security policies for different organizations

2. Organization Management Testing:
   - Test CRUD operations for organizations via API and UI
   - Verify invite system functionality and member management

3. Subdomain Tenancy Testing:
   - Test application access via different subdomains
   - Verify correct organization context loading based on subdomain
   - Test authentication and authorization scoped to subdomains

4. Billing Infrastructure Testing:
   - Verify integration with the chosen billing provider
   - Test subscription creation, modification, and cancellation
   - Validate usage tracking and billing events recording

5. Tenant Onboarding Flow Testing:
   - Go through the complete onboarding process for a new organization
   - Verify all steps are completed successfully
   - Test edge cases like incomplete onboarding or validation errors

6. Multi-Tenancy Component Testing:
   - Verify all existing features work correctly in a multi-tenant environment
   - Test organization switching functionality
   - Ensure data isolation between different organizations

7. Authentication and Authorization Testing:
   - Test role-based access control within organizations
   - Verify JWT tokens contain correct organization information
   - Test protected routes with various organization and role combinations

8. Performance Testing:
   - Conduct load tests simulating multiple organizations
   - Verify database query performance with organization-based filtering
   - Test caching mechanisms if implemented

9. Data Isolation and Backup Testing:
   - Verify data export functionality for specific organizations
   - Test backup and restore processes for organization-specific data
   - Ensure no data leakage between organizations

10. Multi-Tenant Test Suite Execution:
    - Run the updated test suite covering multi-tenancy scenarios
    - Verify all existing tests pass with the new multi-tenant architecture
    - Conduct end-to-end testing simulating multiple organizations using the system simultaneously

tasks.title: Implement SaaS Billing and Subscription Management System
tasks.description: Develop a comprehensive SaaS billing and subscription management system, integrating with Stripe for payment processing, creating subscription plans, implementing usage-based billing, and providing billing dashboards for customers and administrators.
tasks.details:
1. Integrate Stripe API:
   - Install Stripe SDK for Node.js
   - Set up Stripe webhook endpoint for event handling
   - Implement secure handling of Stripe API keys

2. Create Subscription Plans:
   - Define plan tiers (free, premium, enterprise) in Stripe Dashboard
   - Implement API endpoints for fetching available plans
   - Create UI components for displaying plan options

3. Implement Usage-Based Billing:
   - Design and implement a usage tracking system
   - Create API endpoints for reporting usage metrics
   - Set up Stripe metered billing for usage-based charges

4. Add Payment Method Management:
   - Implement Stripe Elements for secure card input
   - Create API endpoints for adding, updating, and removing payment methods
   - Develop UI components for managing payment methods

5. Create Customer Billing Dashboard:
   - Design and implement a billing overview page
   - Display current subscription, usage, and upcoming charges
   - Show billing history and allow invoice downloads
   - Implement subscription upgrade/downgrade functionality

6. Develop Billing Admin Tools:
   - Create an admin dashboard for managing customer subscriptions
   - Implement functionality to view and modify customer billing details
   - Add ability to generate reports on revenue, active subscriptions, etc.

7. Handle Subscription Lifecycle:
   - Implement logic for subscription creation, modification, and cancellation
   - Set up automated billing cycles and payment collection
   - Handle failed payments and implement dunning management

8. Implement Proration and Credits:
   - Set up proration logic for subscription changes
   - Implement system for applying credits to customer accounts

9. Create Notification System:
   - Set up email notifications for successful payments, failed charges, etc.
   - Implement in-app notifications for billing-related events

10. Ensure Compliance and Security:
    - Implement proper encryption for sensitive data
    - Ensure compliance with PCI DSS standards
    - Set up audit logs for all billing-related actions

11. Develop Testing and Sandbox Environments:
    - Create a sandbox environment for testing billing scenarios
    - Implement unit and integration tests for billing functions
    - Set up end-to-end tests for critical billing workflows
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Unit Testing:
   - Write unit tests for all billing-related functions
   - Test calculation logic for usage-based billing
   - Verify proper handling of Stripe API responses

2. Integration Testing:
   - Test Stripe API integration using test mode
   - Verify webhook handling for various Stripe events
   - Test integration between usage tracking and billing systems

3. End-to-End Testing:
   - Simulate complete subscription lifecycle (create, upgrade, downgrade, cancel)
   - Test payment method addition, update, and removal
   - Verify proration calculations for subscription changes

4. User Interface Testing:
   - Test responsiveness and functionality of billing dashboards
   - Verify correct display of subscription and usage information
   - Test accessibility of billing-related UI components

5. Security Testing:
   - Perform penetration testing on billing-related endpoints
   - Verify proper encryption of sensitive billing data
   - Test access controls for billing information

6. Performance Testing:
   - Simulate high load on billing systems to ensure scalability
   - Test response times for billing-related API calls

7. Compliance Testing:
   - Verify compliance with PCI DSS standards
   - Test audit log functionality for billing actions

8. Error Handling and Edge Cases:
   - Test system behavior with failed payments
   - Verify proper handling of subscription edge cases (e.g., cancellations, refunds)
   - Test dunning process for overdue accounts

9. Sandbox Environment Testing:
   - Verify all billing scenarios in the sandbox environment
   - Test billing admin tools using test data

10. User Acceptance Testing:
    - Conduct UAT with stakeholders for billing dashboards and admin tools
    - Verify ease of use and clarity of billing information presentation

tasks.title: Implement Advanced SaaS Features and Scale Infrastructure
tasks.description: Develop and integrate advanced SaaS features including analytics, collaboration tools, API management, security enhancements, and performance optimizations to support multi-tenant scale.
tasks.details:
1. Advanced Analytics and Reporting:
   - Implement a data warehouse using BigQuery or Redshift
   - Create ETL pipelines to aggregate and transform usage data
   - Develop customizable dashboards using a BI tool like Metabase or Looker
   - Implement role-based access control for analytics

2. Cross-Organization Collaboration:
   - Develop a shared workspace feature for inter-org projects
   - Implement document sharing and version control
   - Create a user directory and permission system for external collaborators

3. API Rate Limiting and Quotas:
   - Implement API gateway using Kong or AWS API Gateway
   - Set up rate limiting rules based on subscription tiers
   - Create a quota management system for API usage
   - Develop a dashboard for customers to monitor their API usage

4. Advanced Security Features:
   - Integrate SSO using OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect
   - Implement SAML support for enterprise customers
   - Set up multi-factor authentication
   - Enhance data encryption at rest and in transit

5. Custom Branding per Organization:
   - Create a theming engine for UI customization
   - Implement a custom domain feature for each organization
   - Develop a white-labeling system for resellers

6. Data Export and Migration Tools:
   - Create data export functionality in various formats (CSV, JSON)
   - Develop an import wizard for data migration from other systems
   - Implement scheduled backups and restore functionality

7. Performance Monitoring and Optimization:
   - Set up application performance monitoring using New Relic or Datadog
   - Implement database query optimization and caching strategies
   - Develop a load testing suite using tools like k6 or Apache JMeter
   - Create auto-scaling policies for the application and database tiers

8. Multi-Tenant Architecture Enhancements:
   - Refactor database schema for improved multi-tenancy
   - Implement tenant isolation at the application layer
   - Develop a tenant provisioning and management system
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Analytics and Reporting:
   - Verify data accuracy in the data warehouse
   - Test dashboard rendering and customization
   - Validate role-based access control for different user types

2. Cross-Organization Collaboration:
   - Test shared workspace creation and management
   - Verify document sharing and version control functionality
   - Validate permission systems for external collaborators

3. API Rate Limiting and Quotas:
   - Perform load testing to verify rate limiting effectiveness
   - Test quota enforcement across different subscription tiers
   - Validate API usage dashboard accuracy

4. Security Features:
   - Test SSO integration with major providers
   - Verify SAML authentication for enterprise accounts
   - Conduct penetration testing and security audits

5. Custom Branding:
   - Test theming engine with various color schemes and logos
   - Verify custom domain functionality
   - Validate white-labeling for reseller accounts

6. Data Export and Migration:
   - Test data export in all supported formats
   - Verify data integrity during import processes
   - Validate backup and restore functionality

7. Performance Monitoring and Optimization:
   - Conduct load testing to verify system performance under stress
   - Test auto-scaling policies under various load conditions
   - Verify accuracy of performance metrics in monitoring tools

8. Multi-Tenant Architecture:
   - Test data isolation between tenants
   - Verify tenant provisioning and management processes
   - Conduct scalability testing with a large number of tenants
